lines.text: You could have broken a rib! Who the hell do you think you are?
I'll tell you who I am, you're full of shit, that's who I am!
Do you know who I really am?
Oliver Twist?
I wish I could think of a response to that, but right now I'm in the middle of a hot flash!
You just sat down and creased yourself!
Do you think someone could fall in love that fast?

Of course. It happened to me once. I was at the Tony awards two years ago, I saw this woman from the back. She was wearing a blue taffeta dress, and she had gleaming black hair, cascading over creamy white shoulders. I fell instantly in love. then she turned 'round and it was you.
It was green actually.
What was?
The dress. It was from the second act of "Somewhere every summer" I borrowed it from wardrobe.
I might have known you wouldn't have bought it.
Do you love her, Jason?
Love her? I can't even hear her from the balcony!
Then why?
Christ! Don't you understand anything about sex?
Apparently not.
Were you eavesdropping?
Of course not, who could hear anything over the clash of your bracelets.
What about you, my love? Are you going to marry that nice young man?
Well, I've gone from no to perhaps but I'm not fooling anyone. Not even myself.
I take it this is my friend and not my agent talking.
I just don't want to see you turn into one of those dotty women writers who drink too much and wear hats.
Jason, I found out why Phoebe left you.
Allison, will you be quiet, we're rehearsing.
Jason, I'm divorcing you.
How do you feel?
Sleepy. Incredibly sleepy. Do you think that's the alcohol?
Either that or the bananas.
God, you're crass!
I'm supposed to be, I'm you agent.
Blanche, you're not in the chorus anymore. You don't have to be heard at the back of the house.

[waking]
Oh, god! I had the most horrible dream! I was at the opening night party, the mayor was sitting next to me...
[remembering]
Oh... God!
Where'd everybody go?
The reviews came in.
Whenever we sit in a restaurant, you always take the best seat, with your back to the wall so everyone can see you!
And so they can't see you! You dress like a walking garage sale!
Leo, you seem like an intelligent man; why do you to all the trouble to hide it with ugly ties?
It's no trouble.
